title: Microlearning for Strengthening Citizen Capabilities to Prevent Online Violence: Four-Stage Intervention Model Simulation and Community Application

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in psychology and pedagogy, digital literacy. Basic understanding of social systems, legal procedures, and citizen rights related to online violence.
context.additional_context: An online violence prevention competency enhancement program for pre-service teachers, optimized for smartphones to address environments without PC access. Emphasizes the potential for linking civic education in school settings and establishing community collaboration systems.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the 4-stage intervention model for online violence situations (Recognition-Responsibility-Intervention-Follow-up) with 85% accuracy and connect their rights and responsibilities as citizens within social relational contexts.
Learners consistently select and apply appropriate intervention strategies considering cultural contexts and institutional environments in simulation scenarios for three consecutive attempts.
Learners write team-based prevention strategy project reports based on real-world cases, proposing applicability that reflects community characteristics and institutional infrastructure.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
